website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for the dog who can't decide if he wants to run in front, behind or beside you.
pros: With a 48-inch leash, two handles (one on the collar and another by your hip), and a design that allows the dog more freedom in positioning himself, this product strikes a balance between control and adventure
Comes with a reflective thread for those who prefer night jogging
cons: Allowing your dog more freedom could mean he'll trip you up if you aren't paying attention

customer_reviews.title: Awesome leash
customer_reviews.text: I love this leash. Now my dog can walk me. I walk my dog and I can play PoGo with both hands. Also, it's easy to pick up doggy doodoo when I'm not trying to hold on to him with the leash in 1 hand. I also like that it's reflective so we're highly visible when we're out walking at night.
customer_reviews.author: HCJ

customer_reviews.title: Not that "Tuff"
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work pretty well for keeping hands free on walks and runs, but unfortunately it's just not that "tuff". The leash snapped near one of the knots that separate the stretch and nonstretch part. Luckily we were just in the back yard at the time. If you have a dog that occasionally pulls this may not be the right product for you. Also I'm still within the 60 day manufacture warranty, but since I bought it on Amazon I'm apparently not covered past 30 day.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tillmann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2 dogs
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have a 40-lb Australian Shepherd/Husky mix and a 22-lb blind and deaf full-bred Australian Shepherd puppy. The puppy requires more hands on leading, so when we can't both walk them this is the perfect way to still focus on the puppy's need and walk our well-trained dog hands-free. The handle helps if I need to pull her back during our run/walks. The main reason I gave this four out of five stars, there was one instance where our dog saw a squirrel and when she pulled the belt unclipped. Thankfully there was enough tension in the beginning our dog hesitated instead of bolting, but caution to those who may have a more active dog.
customer_reviews.author: SavvyVT

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU’RE WONDERING, THIS IS IT CHIEF
customer_reviews.text: AHHH I WISH I COULD STOP WITH ALL CAPS BUT THAT’S HOW AMAZING THIS PRODUCT IS, y’all!!! First of all, it’s such a simple yet genius design. Long story short, I’ve been injured plenty of times in the past because my woofer gets excited & wants to bolt to any animal in its vicinity. The resistant bungee leash is perfect for puppers who have a tendency to pull. My buddy is a year & a half old but has the energy of a 7 month old. This handsfree leash has helped my wrist & hand heal from past strains, has synchronized our trail runs together, & has made me more eager/inclined to walk my dog various times daily!
customer_reviews.author: Pmm

customer_reviews.title: Works well for pulling dog , especially when used with a no-pull harness
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my standard poodle pulls and I’ve already gotten an tendinitis in my elbow because of it. I bought a no-pull harness (the one where you attach the leash on the chest of the dog). It works so well. The bungee on the leash acts as a buffer when it stretched. It has resistance so you don’t feel it on you right away. My tip is to use this with the no pull harness as I’ve described. One day I used a regular dog harness and my dog just pulled and pulled. It was annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but a bit too long.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty satisfied with this overall. I bought it for running, and I'm completely sold on the hands free style now. It feels sturdy and well-made, and the leash is nice looking. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because it's so long that if your dog runs right next to you (rather that a few feet out to your side) the leash gets close to dragging on the ground and feels like it could trip you. And there's really no way to shorten the length of the leash, aside from tying knots into it (which is what I've done).
customer_reviews.author: Echo S.

customer_reviews.title: Novel and Innovative Method of Dog Restraint
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a hands free leash for four years on a twenty pound dog. I lost it and replaced it with the $23.00 Tuff Mutt hands free leash. My first impression was that it is extremely heavy duty compared to my last leash. It is thick and wide. The bungee is strong. If you have a large dog you don't have to worry about the strength. A note for newbie's to the hands free leash. You may think it would pull you off balance, not necessarily true. The leash is connected to the core area of the body and is much less affected and far more stable than holding it with your hands. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: raj from chicagoTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for a couple years but purchased another one when we got a second dog just for the cord to use with my old belt. I don’t take my dogs anywhere without these. I’m able to push my daughter, running stroller, and two dogs. It’s worth every bit of money. The one I have had for at least 2 years still works great. Only a little faded. There’s no doubt this second one will hold up just as long.
customer_reviews.author: Lovelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this leash!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd hands-free leash and I bought this bc I lost part of the leash on my 1st one. Different company and leash...this one is wonderful. I spent about $10 more on this and I definitely see why it's worth the extra money. Great quality and does not disappoint. This is one of the only hands-free leashes that allows dogs to move back and forth, which is ultimately why I purchased. My dogs like to move around and this helped a bunch. I have 5 dogs and need all the help I can get with walking all of them! Happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: The best leash we've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This was a game changer. I was having a terrible time running with my dog. It's duck season, and she has no self control when she sees ducks, and there was a point when she lunged and nearly wrenched my arm out of joint and pulled the leash out of my hand. After that I started looking for a better alternative, and this is it! This leash is comfortable for both of us, with a lot of give, so I can run smoothly, and she understands that she can't go beyond a certain point. I love that it was two places to grab if you need to have a little bit tighter control. The best leash we've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Hand

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for running
customer_reviews.text: This is great for running with my not so fabulously trained 50lb dog. He stops and sniffs and then starts all out sprinting, so the bungee aspect of the leash is the only reason he doesn’t pull me down. The hand loops are great for when we are passing people. Adjustable to fit both me and my boyfriend. Seems very sturdy - should hold up well even though my dog spends most of the time pulling me along. Also double as a great way to walk you dog and drink your coffee without spilling.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Casino

customer_reviews.title: Tuff Mutt Pets completely blew me away!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Tuff Mutt Hands Free Dog Leash! It makes running with my 2 yr old dog a delight - he can run back and forth checking out both sides of the trails while my arms are free to do what they should do while running. I was dismayed when the bungee cord within the leash broke. I contacted Tuff Mutt and they replaced it for FREE - AMAZING! Thank you Tuff Mutt; I'll recommend you to all of my running, dog loving friends.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Good for Walking Too
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and convenient. It does get caught if the dog goes in a circle all the way around you but is easy to correct. I found if a dog pulls it can cause my back to become achy but I still very much like this leash. Well made and nice to be hands free.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: This is the hands-free leash you're looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first hands-free leash that I have bought or used and it is exactly what I was hoping for. I use it for running/walking intervals with my 30-pound mutt who never quite learned not to pull on a leash. At first I thought the bungee would be too strong for him, but it has worked out perfectly. With some short training sessions, he learned very quickly to slow down when he feels the tug of the bungee. The webbing and clips are quality materials. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: muddy boots

customer_reviews.title: Straps did not stay tight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leash to run with my dog. Overall, I like how it allows me to be hands free while running and free to pump my arms. What I don’t like is that it loosened as I ran so that by the end of 4 miles it was falling off my hips. When it was tight, it was higher up on my back, so when my dog was pulling, it would hurt my lower back. If I had running pants with belt loops, maybe I wouldn’t have these problems. Good quality and I like the bungee aspect as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Changes Everything!
customer_reviews.text: I have a little rescue who after much training is still difficult to walk. This makes life so much easier! When she pulls, my arms don't feel like they're being dislodged from my shoulders. If feel free and she still has freedom to roam. Wish I would have bought this sooner! Quality stuff, too. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: heyleese

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hands free leash!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to walk and run with my 65 pound Aussie mutt. I have my hands free to walk or run normally and he’s still secured at my side. I like the slight bungee action on the leash so if he stops to sniff something I don’t get pulled off my feet. The belt part is comfortable and the leash slides nicely around the belt. The only complaint I have is the leash was slightly too long so I tied a knot in it to shorten it. No biggie. Would highly recommend this leash.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for runners and hikers
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possibly one of the best things I've ever bought. I was nervous it would enable my dog to pull me like a rag doll but it's actually the opposite. It has him walking and running next to me smoothly and it leaves my hands free. If he goes too far to the side, the bungee pulls him back without throwing me out of stride. It's a great leash.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Gosselin

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: There are clasps at each end, one to connect to the belt and one to connect to your dogs leash/harness. I'ved used this leash about 5 times and one of the clasps now does not open far enough to unbuckle the leash from my dogs harness. I actually had to cut the leash off the harness to get my dog out of his harness. Poorly made product. Not only did I waste my money on buying this, but now I also have to purchase a new harness as well (since the clasp from the leash is still attached to the harness and you can not unbuckle the harness with the clasp attached).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The concept is good but I had two problems with it
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good but I had two problems with it. I walk with a German Shepherd and the leash is too short. There were times when I came close to stepping on one of his hind legs. The leash length probably is fine with smaller dogs but there either should be optional lengths or an adjustable length leash. The second problem I have with it is that the clip that lets you connect the leash to the belt is on the belt and not the leash. This was awkward for me as a right handed person.
customer_reviews.author: C. Overgaard

customer_reviews.title: The BEST for running with your dog
customer_reviews.text: I had run previously with my elkhound and now with my husky. I had never tried a hands-free leash and always got frustrated with the sore shoulder/arm after a few miles. Although I was skeptical of using a hands-free leash, I finally decided to give it a try. TOTAL GAME CHANGER! We ran 7.5 miles on the first run. It was FANTASTIC! I had hesitated to try it because I thought any jerking my dog did would pull me. This is actually not the case. There is a little pulling if he goes after a rabbit or squirrel, but is surprisingly very minimal. I love this leash and will never go back!
customer_reviews.author: katebernard07

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I just rescued a 2yr old Alaskan Husky and trying to run with him on a standard leash was a nightmare. I actually hurt my feet because my stride was so off so I went looking for a better way to run with him. This leash is amazing and perfect. I love that I can get my stride and pace back and that my Husky doesn't pull as much being "free" to run how he is made to. This leash has changed our morning runs for the better! The extra handles to pull him close are placed perfectly. I am so happy we found this leash.
customer_reviews.author: Sara S.

customer_reviews.title: This gave my disabled son more independence!
customer_reviews.text: My son is disabled and when he walks his dog, because of his difficulties with his hands and legs, it was hard for him to independently do this. This leash was a God send! His hands are free to use the plastic bags to pick up his dogs poop now, and with the addition of a headlamp it totally freed him up to enjoy the experience of walking his dog and doing it independently! Thank you for duch a great product at such a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Warren Dean Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Great for multiple dogs
customer_reviews.text: I got this leash because I had a small dog, then added a big dog to the family. Walking both on the usual 6-ft leads was difficult as the new big one was still being trained not to pull. This helped me to have control on the dog (using the holds) and use my body to help stabilize. Then I also had a hand free for the small dog's leash. We also love this when we go out to festivals and we want our hands free. We just attach our dog to this, she sits by our side, and we are hands free for food and BEvERages!
customer_reviews.author: km22

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it 4 times on the 2 mile walk with my 23 lb pug mix. So far so good! It’s shorten than our old leash so need to get used to that. But it’s very sturdy and I like how the lease slides around the waist belt so he can go from one side of the sidewalk to the other.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We love these leashes! This is our second time buying (the first was accidentally left on the garage floor and our truck ran over the buckle). We use this for walks, hikes, and runs with our two dogs. We purchased a "V" shaped two dog attachment, so no tangling. Love this hands free system. The bungee section reduces the pull. We also reach down and use the lower handle if the girls need to stay closer by us. I have NO complaints about this leash!
customer_reviews.author: Claire Burke

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I now have two hands-free leashes. I bought this one because the other one had a leash that was just too long and was causing my dog to get tangled up, or me to trip as we were running. My dog tends to run close to me, and a long leash was just too much. This is one of only a handful of companies that offer the leash in a shorter option. I wish it were just a tad bit shorter, but we're making this one work. It's a good quality set, and I anticipate it working out for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Designed by Non-Runners!
customer_reviews.text: This leash will NOT work for running with your dog. The leash loosens with the slightest tension and ends up falling down. Unless you HOLD the leash you will end up tripping. What's the point of a belt if you have to hold it? My dog is not that strong, she's a Whippet (23 lbs) and we need to stop every mile to tighten the belt. Frustrating on LSD days as well as interval days.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a game changer! My husband and I have a very active puppy who pulls very hard on her leash. My hubby likes to take her running with him but she would constantly dart off to the side trying to chase after a leaf or a bird and my hubby would get jerked over to the side. Also trying to run with only one arm is very challenging. This hands free leash has held up with our puppies constant stopping and darting and pulling without any issues and the bungee cord helps to keep the hubby balanced when the puppy decides to stop suddenly. We are so happy we purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: kes

customer_reviews.title: Well made but belt doesn’t hold up weight well
customer_reviews.text: I walk dogs part time and I was hoping for a good waist belt to carry my treat and phone pouch and to clip leashes onto for dogs who pull. I did not use the actual leash part which probably would help it work together better; I have to use my client’s leashes. Anyway, this didn’t work for what I needed it to do. It wouldn’t stay tightened over my coat with my pouch attached. Maybe if my coat wasn’t less slippery it would work better but I kind of need it to work on everything so I will ben returning and searching did something more load bearing.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect length and very well made
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for me. I have a rambunctious Boxer, and walk the trails in the Olympics taking pictures. She's still too young to trust to stay with me, but I don't want to leave her at home. I was playing the dickens, coming home to blurred pictures from holding onto a leash while trying to shoot. She never drags me, stays right with me on this leash, and there is enough length for her to sniff around while I concentrate on my shot. I love it. It's comfortable, she has plenty of wander room, and I am able to use both my hands to shoot :)
customer_reviews.author: Christine D. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: This is overly sturdy for our little corgi (he's not big/strong enough to release the bungee part), but I LOVE LOVE LOVE it. Somehow, we never get tangled, he never trips me...I just mindlessly run with him next to me, sometimes chasing after squirrels, sometimes lagging behind, but rarely do I have to stop and adjust anything...the belt just circles around me. I was super skeptical, but as another review stated, "a total game changer". Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Missy Malick

customer_reviews.title: Great for running!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use while running with my dog. It works well. The bungee adds just enough give that I don't get jerked when my dog decides to go after a bunny on our run! Not having to hold the leash while running is so much nicer, but the dual handles give you the ability to grab it if you need to. It is hard to get use to the stretchiness of the bungee when she decides to pull really hard, but fortunately that doesn't happen on our runs, just on our leisurely walks.
customer_reviews.author: Nise

customer_reviews.title: Good for hikes!
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for hikes where I can’t let my dog off the leash. I like the length, my dog is able to walk far enough ahead of me without pulling me along for the walk. Just a warning, if your dog is like mine and likes to chase after birds or small animals, it’s not the most wonderful feeling to be pulled at the waist at the weight of a 60 pound dog when you’re not expecting it...
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Escape proof
customer_reviews.text: I got this to run with my boyfriend’s 80 lb 2 year old lab mix. He’s an absolutely crazy pup: pulls, jumps, and tries to escape. Mainly I like that he’s attached to me so I don’t have worry about him getting away. Running is the only way to get his energy out but he’s pulled free a few times to chase dogs or squirrels. With the harness I still end up holding the leash to direct him and keep him under control, but it does allow me to use my hands if I need to. We aren’t ready for hands free yet.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running or walking with your dog
customer_reviews.text: I use this a lot when I run or go for a walk with my dog. The only con is that the leash part I think its a little weighted with the bungee part on the waist but not too bad. Sometimes I use the waist band with a different leash at times if I'm going for a run and use this leash if I'm going for a walk. The handles definitely help to keep my dog in line and remind her to correct herself if we see another dog or a squirrel.
customer_reviews.author: Alsa V

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as Stunt Puppy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace a Stunt Puppy leash that finally wore out after 3 years of consistent running. I was pretty happy with this leash when it arrived - loved the color choices available and it seemed pretty durable. Well, 3 runs in and the leash snapped- I heard an audible snap and couldn’t figure out what it was, then I realized all of the stitching came loos and the “bungee” elastic effect of the leash was no longer effective or present. I’m returning this leash and ordering a Stunt Puppy instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Williams

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this as it really allowed me to go for a run with my dog without getting pulled all over the place. However, I was so sad yesterday when we were getting ready for a run and my dog pulled away from me and the latch broke. I think I'll try a different brand as I love the concept.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Second time purchase ... supported me after the surgery
customer_reviews.text: I love this leash! When I purchased this for the first time, I took a breast cancer surgery so I couldn't walk with my big German Shepherd girl. But after a few week of the surgery, I started to walk with her by using this. I couldn't hold the leash so this worked very well. Still now I use this. Hopefully this leash is registered as the breast cancer support item.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Mom

customer_reviews.title: Testing on a 120 lbs malamute
customer_reviews.text: So I initially ordered this as a trail hiking leash. I don't want my dog running free but I did want more control since I will be backpacking into deep off trail woods. I bought this to protect her from running into traps, bears, and other things. so far it is much shorter than I thought. looks like great stitching (I sew often and can tell right away). Product came very fast almost next day and as described. it's just the same length as a regular long leash you buy at pet smart. retractable leashes just are not strong enough for this breed so those are my initial thoughts. I will update after a week of use,
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Worst Leash Ever
customer_reviews.text: Used this for about 2 weeks to run and hike with my 60 pound Goldendoodle. While running, the waist strap will become loose repeatedly, which was very distracting and annoying that I had to continually tighten it. Also, while hiking at the beach, the clip that attaches to my dogs collar became locked open without me knowing and my dog got away from me! Luckily, he listens well and came back, but imagine if we were in a busy intersection! Terrible product, I would not recommend. I did really like the bungee effect of the leash... if only someone could make a product that was more sturdy and well made with this design, it could be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say this leash prevents pulling but I paired it with my dogs gentle lead and it works great! So glad I made this purchase! The only thing I wish was different is a way to "lock in" the waist adjustment. It loosens throughout our walk and I have to tighten it every time. Not a big deal but would sure be great if there was some sort of stopper from it loosening.
customer_reviews.author: margaret warnke

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Walks Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had one of these years ago. It is my absolute favorite new purchase. I use to dread walking my dog but this has made my life so much easier. My big, huge lab also seems not to pull so much with this stretchy leash. It is like he senses he is almost to the end and stops before yanking on it. I can actually carry a bottle of water now and still have the other hand free.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed. Recommended to friends and family!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this leash for our mini golden doodle. We use it for running with our dog, walks, working in the yard, or hanging out around the campfire. Anytime when you just want your hands free. Also great in crowded places like farmers markets or on trails due to the loop handle at the end of the leash that you can hold on to when the dog needs to stay close to you. We also found that our dog pulls less with the built in bungee cord in this leash. We have recommended it to our friends and family! We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Puts all pressure on waist
customer_reviews.text: It works. I had shoulder surgery and couldn’t put weight on my shoulders and chest area (aka use my arms) but still needed to walk my dog. I saw this and it works. All the weight is on my waist. It works good. I would like it to be a little more flexible, but it’s useful. My dog hates it bc she’s a pulled but with this she walks my paste. It’s good handsfree and made well.
customer_reviews.author: H. Koyama

customer_reviews.title: Has made running with my dog a breeze
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a ton of energy and can get too excited when we run. After tripping on her leash one too many times, I got this leash and it's a game changer. She runs close to me, and when she does pull a bit when she sees a dog, etc, the bungee gives some cushion so I don't love my stride. I use a front-clip harness when running which helps keep her on my right side.
customer_reviews.author: cdrown

customer_reviews.title: Great for hands free dog walking!
customer_reviews.text: This leash is fantastic! I take my dog on long walks daily. I love having my hands free. BUT if I need to control my dog (car or another dog passing) the two handles on the leash are perfectly placed. The quality is excellent! Side note, I walked in heavy rain yesterday and the leash was literally dry minutes after I brought it home. It was an added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: S German

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY TUFF MUTT FOR MY TUFF GSP!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very strong German Shorthair Pointer (GSP) that loves to run especially off leash but this is not always convenient and he has to be leashed- this TuffMutt is the ONLY product I have found that gives me the ability to run and control him with enough space for both of us so we don't get tangled up. Very pleased with the product and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: You should definitely own this - especially if you jog with your dog!
customer_reviews.text: This is my wife's favorite leash (to use for our dog)! It's great for jogging. Just click to your waist and to the dog and go. Our dog is big and energetic - having the force pulling at your waist makes it easy to dig in your heels for control. The bungie on the lead helps absorb the pull from the dog. There are two hand loops on the lead so that you can exert control when you need to (one is about a foot from the waist strap and the other is near the end of the lead to keep your dog close when you need to).
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Frenza

customer_reviews.title: Love this leash
customer_reviews.text: I'll never use a standard leash again. I love this leash, along with the Tuff Mutt dog bag holder. I attached the dog bag holder to the belt part of this leash rather than to the leash part, and it's perfect for running or walking. The belt part is a bit challenging to get adjusted right and tends to loosen kind of easily, but it's a minor complaint. The leash part is long enough if you have a well-behaved dog. If you have a "wanderer" like I do, you run into some issues, but that's more dog than leash. This was a great purchase for me and my dog.
customer_reviews.author: TaraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for running!
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't know what to expect, the first hands-free lead I had was simpler and it works great for my terrier mix. The Tuff-Mutt came when promised and is a simple sturdy well thought out design. My Aussie likes to run behind and keep the herd together and this lead is perfect for her. The only drawback for me is that the actual lead part is not adjustable, I'm figuring that is near impossible to do with the bungee aspect, and so every so often I need to tug on the lead to bring her up to not pull. It's a great lead and will be the next choice when the terrier chews through the first one.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: strong and trusty
customer_reviews.text: love this leash! i'm disabled and have always had a ruff time finding the right leash to hold a 60+ ilb dog when most of the time i'm using a cane or wheelchair. don't have to hold the leash at all anymore and the length is perfect for service dogs and any dog you don't want to have the run of the leash. Update: 2 years later. The leash broke with a much smaller dog. My friends dog got off the leash and almost attacked another dog. It broke the latch. Can something be done about my broken latch? Or do you have to buy one of these every 2 years?
customer_reviews.author: Emily Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for going on walks
customer_reviews.text: We love the hands free leash. Originally purchased this for going on hikes but now use it all the time for walks. It just a lot more natural to walk without holding a leash. Highly recommend. Only issue I've found is that it will slowly loosen over time. However the construction is sturdy, and the buckle and leash clips seem very well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Tired Fellow

customer_reviews.title: This will change your relationship with your dog!
customer_reviews.text: This leash has completely changed our lives! We have a nine-month-old lab who is already 75 pounds and extremely strong. It got to the point where I could barely manage him on walks because he was pulling my arm out of the socket! This hands-free leash is literally the most amazing thing. He doesn't pull half as much, and when he does, I barely feel it. Since your core is so much stronger than your arms, you feel grounded and balanced. It's great to have your hands free for an umbrella, cell phone, coffee or whatever! This has made taking our dog for walks enjoyable and fun again! Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.author: TNL

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for dogs that are not perfect runners.
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a way to keep the waist band doing. It continues to ride up. My dog just keeps the leash tight and even without him pulling it puts pressures on my lower back which is uncomfortable on long runs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have used this leash almost everyday since receiving it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this leash almost everyday since receiving it and can say it works amazingly. I have never had it loosen enough to fall off while out jogging anywhere from 3 miles to 6 miles with my dog. It is just long enough to keep my dog close to me yet giver her some space. The tension when it is stretched out stops her from trying to pull me. I will definitely order again if the need ever arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried any other brand of hands free leash, but I love this. The leash part isn't adjustable, you still have to use your hand if you need the dog close to you suddenly.
customer_reviews.author: 1lostyankee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Leash
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well this leash works! After running with a dog for almost a year with a regular leash, ironically I feel more control with this than I did with the standard. And best of all my hips and back aren't suffering! I love the two grab loops for instances where you need, and I feel like the bungy provides the right amount of control and support. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Hackney

customer_reviews.title: Two paws up!
customer_reviews.text: I now use this leash daily for morning runs with my 70lb Labrador. The bungee in the leash allows him to stop and smell the 'roses' without dislocating any of my joints and the lower handle allows me to keep him close when we pass the two angry Pugs at mile number two. Be prepared for the 'who is walking who' joke about twice a week and for a smoother run with your fur-baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Khosravifar

customer_reviews.title: This is really cool I wish i had got it years ago
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing i love walking around with my dog but sometimes i need both hands when carying things or just taking the morning walk. Its amazing it has slack and some elastic stretch so it doesn't yank hard on the dog. I wish they had this years ago. What would be a cool idea is a retractable one next.
customer_reviews.author: MJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Can finally walk my dog!
customer_reviews.text: Having large, young, excited dogs has its own set of of issues when taking them for walks. I hurt my shoulder this past year and walking them became almost impossible. They are good on a leash, but if they see a squirrel, etc., there is the chance I will get my arm ripped from my body :) This leash is perfect!!! They can't move me and my shoulder is spared! Getting ready to buy a second one so I can try to start walking them together. Wish me luck!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl R. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Handy leash to have with more than one dog
customer_reviews.text: I love having an extra hand now while walking my two dogs. The little one get this waist leash and I can hold the bigger (less mobile) dog's leash in my hand. Works out perfectly. I started wearing the waist part to get used to it for hikes but have started using it for every walk now. And yes, the knots work perfectly! Gives you a nice quick grip without having to put your hand into the straps. Love this leash!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I love the Leash, but is not Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. They are comfortable, nice looking and I can attach two to one belt for walking both of my dogs, but they are not durable. My JRT likes to carry the leash in his mouth sometimes, and just this is causing it to come apart where the cloth meets the bungee part that feels the most durable. He doesn't really chew on it, and we've never had any leash in 9 years do this, so I could not recommend this leash unless you have a dog that doesn't mouth it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Williams

customer_reviews.title: Customer service good, product not
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our 2 dogs, 100# and 70#, both bungees broke within a month, returned one and received a replacement, and the new one lasted a couple weeks. 70# dog pulls some when small prey run by, but we've had other brands that the bungee never broke in, just wanted to try a longer lead that the other brand offered. Not worth it. Customer service did replace the first one that broke, we didn't bother trying to get the other ones replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M Pazik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have a one year old mixed breed dog. She is only 30 pounds but incredibly strong and loves to chase birds and squirrels. This leash has allowed me to take her on trail runs as I train for a 10K. The bungee part of the lease does a great job of absorbing shock if she lunges and the control handles are perfectly placed. We coupled this with a Tuff Mutt harness and it is working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: kk.ro

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Leash
customer_reviews.text: I have a had a few hands free leashes and spent a ton of money on leashes for my dog (he is 77 lbs and a bit ADD). This leash along with the harness has made walking him so much easier and he is so happy when he sees this leash. Even my mom who has a really hard time walking him is able to walk him better (safer) with this leash and harness
customer_reviews.author: Luckybee13

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 60 pound puller
customer_reviews.text: My pup is a hunting hound, but we don't hunt. She's back and forth following her nose and chasing squirrels and cats. This leash is a game changer, when we're in open space I let her free and when we get back to the sidewalk I grab the lower handle and she stays right by my side. Highly recommend. Feels durable so far after 2-3 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Will fit 24-25" waist or smaller.  Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: Worth it!. Changed my hikes/runs with the dog for the better! I was having a hard time finding a belt small enough (I have a 25" waist). This will even go smaller, you just start losing room for the leash to freely slide from side of your waist to the other, but that doesn't bother me, as the whole belt can slide easy if my 70 lb dog moves around. Good quality. Length is perfect and handles are helpful if you need to pull the dog closer when on busy trails or streets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Hands Free Jogging Leash Ever
customer_reviews.text: Durable easy to use and the bungee section works perfect for those times that a squirrel or some other distraction catches your dogs eye while out on a run. I get stopped a ton for folks to ask what kind of leash is this and where to find one. I love it and I just need to reach for the basket where I keep it and my dog gets excited. Convenient hand holds down lower to draw your dog in when in a more crowded scenario. Even use when not running but no I may need my hands free at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Priestley

customer_reviews.title: A must for runners w/ dogs!!
customer_reviews.text: I was always hesitant of running leashes that go around the waist, but the reviews were right--this is an excellent leash!! My dog is a little bit of a puller but the bungee feature is amazing. Also was surprised how having the leash around the CORE would be stronger than using my arm. I was pleasantly surprised how awesome this leash is!
customer_reviews.author: DocJ

customer_reviews.title: Walking a skittish dog on ice in the city
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for walking a newly adopted, skittish dog on icy days in the city. I was afraid if I slipped and fell my nervous dog might take off if I dropped the leash. The strap fits around my waist even when wearing a winter coat and I can just clip it to my regular leash. (The leash it comes with is fine and probably great for running but for my purposes I prefer to use my own leash.) I have used it several times this winter and it has definitely put my mind at ease.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Anderson

customer_reviews.title: hiking hands free with my dog is so great
customer_reviews.text: My girl normally pulls when on leash..an on going problem we are working on. With the hands free bungee a world of difference. She walks so nice. Only thing I did not like was the waist strap. Does as intended but I have to keep adjusting it down.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Happy Running!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 y/o pup and I have been running together for a while, but I've always just used his leash. The leash was so frustrating, because I had to run with it in my hand. It would through off my gait and was difficult to control his pulling. Getting this has completely changed the running experience. My pup is able to run ahead of me and can weave without pulling my hand and messing up my gait. He also has darted for a bunny or two, and the bungy cord totally saves me from being lurched forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice leash. My wife and I bought one before ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice leash. My wife and I bought one before going on vacation with our dogs. We took a test drive around the block and she quickly bought another so we could use these exclusively on vacation where we take long walks with the dogs. The lease is solid and the bungie action is perfect - it's not too loose that it doesn't do anything but it's tight enough that it slows a sudden lunge by the dog so you're not taking a direct assault to the waist. A huge plus is that there's a handle near the hook so you can detach it at will and it becomes a regular leash. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy leash
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy leash, fits my waist. I love the bottom handle for holding my dog close at main roads. It’s a bit longer than I would like for running, he stays super close to me so it would be nice if it was a foot shorter. My dog is 55 pounds, no concerns about him breaking free
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only way to run now
customer_reviews.text: It has taken a bit to get used to running with this instead of a leash he certainly likes to extend the full length of the bungee sometimes but having both hands-free allows for a more natural run style and once we get into rhythm the Bungie does keeping from pulling too hard
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: I currently only use it to walk the dog. I am getting him used to the leash before I start running with him on it. I like that it can move around the belt. However I think if I didn't have an undershirt on it may pinch my skin. I am a little flabby. I like the handle close to the clip as I can grab it when cars come and make sure he does not run out in front of them if they do not have room to give me space and I don't have room to move farther off the road. I like the hands free usefulness of this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this leash
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this leash. Better than the previous one I had. I like the handles to easily pull the dog closer when running as we pass other people. The bungee allows her to pull, and she pulls hard after other animals, without pulling me over. My only complaint is that the plastic of the adjuster on the belt prevents her from circling me. I have to turn the belt if she does circle behind me. Not a big deal, but my last leash did not do that. I would buy this leash again.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Genden

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: If I had written this when I first got it, I would have given it 5 stars. Makes running with my 9 month old puppy an absolute joy! I didn't think that I'd use the belt, but it's really great. However, after about a month of use (for running only, we have another leash for walks around the neighborhood) it's fraying at the top, near where I attach it to my dogs harness and I don't think it's going to last very long. I'm not seeing other reviews like this so maybe I just got a bad one?
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: This leash is great for going on hikes with my dog
customer_reviews.text: This leash is great for going on hikes with my dog. She took to the bungee type leash quickly and doesn't try to pull like crazy. Surprisingly even if she does pull, I'm not yanked forward like I would normally have been with my regular hand held leash. Just a heads up if you are on the larger side in your midsection this might have to go up a little higher than your waist but it still works well. Only con I have is the length of the leash, I wish it were a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Sins

customer_reviews.title: Love it -- hands free dog walking
customer_reviews.text: I take my golden retriever hiking and I am using trekking poles. Now I can use the poles and not hang onto the lease. There is "buungie" type" cord in the middle which keeps the leash from jerking or the dog from pulling me off a rock. The waistbelt can rotate a little bit so that the dog can swtich sides. There a place to grab on the dog near his neck and near my waist. Seems very solidly belt. So far we love it.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Great for going hands free
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an 88lb lab that chewed through a similar leash. I love this leash. It allows me to go hands free as well as two well placed holds to reign him in. I’ve had it for two months with lots of walks. Looking forward to runs now that the weather is perking up.
customer_reviews.author: Mikejrod

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but could be more durable
customer_reviews.text: The leash lasted about 2.5 years before the clip broke and handle frayed to where it couldn't be used anymore. My medium sized dog isn't a puller so I had hoped it would have lasted a bit longer but maybe my expectations aren't realistic. It's useful for running but also during the winters when I want to keep my hands in my pockets/handsfree.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for arms free running with a dog that loves ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for arms free running with a dog that loves to pull! My arms no longer hurt and I can freely move my arms for a better run. The leash is a good length to keep my dog close enough to me so he won’t wander or greet other joggers. And the strength of the cord is sturdy enough it pulls him back toward me when I stand still. The only downside I would say is the part around my waist pulls pretty tight and kind of gets uncomfortable around my waist and back after a few miles. I’d suggest to the makers a thicker more padded strap for the waist please!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Best Pet Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have made for my dogs. I have one older pup and one young pup we are training. This allows me to walk my older dog and keep my hands free to train the younger. Before I had to carry two leashes and the dogs were constantly getting intertwined. This leash has made our walks stress free! Good quality with plenty of stretch so you are not jerked around while walking. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt. I have a 90lb German Shepherd who is also my service animal. When we go in public it is great to have this because I have full use of both my hands. In stressful situations I can easy grab it and walk her with it just like a normal leash. It also has a stretchy feature that gives it a little extra length when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ri

customer_reviews.title: Good leash.
customer_reviews.text: Great running leash for my dog. The double handles make it really easy to gain control of my dog if another one comes by. My old running leash didn't have that and it was a pain. Be aware that you might end up wearing the same colors as your running leash and may back into being a little "too stylish" for the park. Whoever saw us that day definitely hated us.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t stand the test of time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July of 2018 and one of the handles has already broken. It is not ’tuff’.
customer_reviews.author: jpdogma

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this leash as a running leash for my and my dog. That worked out so wonderfully that I now use this leash as her main leash and I don’t ever see us returning to a traditional leash any time soon. The hands free and ~360 degree rotation is too nice to go back. The bungee has also helped my dog reduce her pulling, which is nice. I love this leash and I’ve been using it full time for about three years now.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ciskowski

customer_reviews.title: I live by a park where there's a heavy fine for walking sans leash
customer_reviews.text: I live by a park where there's a heavy fine for walking sans leash. I'm usually out with my dog plus a baby in a stroller (and frequently a phone in my hand). I hate tying holding the leash in my hand (because I only have 2!) and I don't like tying it to the stroller either because he's a big strong dog and it makes me nervous! So this leash belt really works for me! I would highly recommend it to anyone who walks the dog with a stroller. My husband and I use it every time we go out with him now.
customer_reviews.author: gk

customer_reviews.title: Improves our walks tremendously
customer_reviews.text: This leash is great! The hands free part is cool but what I really love is that it helps our dog be better on the leash (in conjunction with a front clip no pull harness) because of the bungee-like part that will pull back if he pulls to extend it to it's max length. He's still no angel on the leash but it makes our walks so much more manageable!
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend, love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my 2 year old boxer, she loves being off leash so when we hike this makes it so much more easier for the both of us, it's changed the way I look at walking my dog forever! it's not a chore anymore, I don't have to worry about dropping the leash ever. And when she pulls she's attached to my waist so I don't have to worry about her pulling my arm out! Totally recommend, love it!!! 10/10
customer_reviews.author: SNL

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, hands free is worth it
customer_reviews.text: Best leash ever. This is the second I’ve purchased. the first lasted 3 years with use multiple times a day, often used for many miles at a time and the hands free aspect is so wonderful. When our first finally gave out I immediately ordered the same one. The leash itself is still in tact, it broke at the clip that attaches to the harness. Can’t go wrong with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy Rae

customer_reviews.title: buy one size larger.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the unit I bought was about 6 inches longer. I went with the size of 'large' and for a 50 lb dog, I am afraid when walking fast I will kick the dog's hind legs. So I have to be slightly careful. Otherwise, the unit is sturdy. Concern is the stiching has material edges that are VERY sharp as if cauterized. Could scratch/injure ones-self because the edges where corners sewn are very sharp, not soft. But I'd buy again, has nice handles at each end of the cord as picture shows.
customer_reviews.author: road_warrior

customer_reviews.title: nice value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a different brand of waist leash I had previously. I like the length, not too long or short. The waist adjustment tends to loosen up a bit as you use it, I have to ensure each time I head out it is tight enough otherwise it falls down over your hips unexpectedly. Just a 'get used to it' thing. My previous leash costs 49.00 now so this is a good value
customer_reviews.author: Debra Yeaman

customer_reviews.title: Good with addition
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this for hiking since I wanted to start using trekking poles and it was a little short and has very little give and my dog was practically choking herself when making abrupt stops and starts or jumping a downed tree so I had to purchase the zero shock extension also but the combination of the two is working for us. I also recommend looping it through one of your belt loops to keep it from sliding down or riding up on your body.
customer_reviews.author: DAWN E LAM

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for a friend. A little disappointed in the color of the "coral" when it arrived but still gifted it. My friend has used it twice so far with her 20lb dog on hikes and reports it works well. Having the double handle on the leash it what attracted me to this leash over other similar versions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best..
customer_reviews.text: Strong leash, but wouldn’t say the best for working out. The leash is very stiff and doesn’t act as much as a bungee at all. My dog still pulls me and it actually kinda hurts my back. The swivel feature is honestly so distracting and an annoyance when trying to run or walk
customer_reviews.author: lanette

customer_reviews.title: No need for any other leash!
customer_reviews.text: If you own a dog that was bred for pulling, you will 110% appreciate this awesome leash. I have owned many dishes in the past, and they usually pull you tight from the waist, or the elastic is not as sturdy. This leash, solves all those issues. Totally recommend! Watch The video!
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Great leash!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leash to run with my dog but since he keeps jumping all over me I just use it for walking now. The leash is great and takes like 99% of the strain when he pulls. I also love the two handle options, they come in very handy. When I was running with him it worked great, maybe when my dog matures we can try it again. It seems high quality, tough stitching and my dog chews it frequently and it hasn't ruptured.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew O.

product_meta.title: Tuff Mutt Hands Free Dog Leash for Running, Walking, Hiking, Durable Dual-Handle Bungee Leash is 4 Feet Long with Reflective Stitching, with an Adjustable Waist Belt That Fits up to 42 Inch Waist
feature_bullets: EASY GLIDE BELT CLIP: Unlike other hands free leashes which force your leash to stay in one position, our durable clip smoothly slides along the lightweight belt allowing your dog move easily from side to side which means more freedom for you and your pup.

ADEQUATE RUNNING ROOM: Your dog can comfortably run in front of you, or beside you, without feeling like you are stepping on their heels. The 4 foot leash is long enough to provide plenty of space and stretches out to 5 feet when fully extended.

BEST FOR MEDIUM and LARGE DOGS: A strong durable bungee is placed between the two handles to keep your dogs pulling to a minimum and to absorb shock. To get the full benefits of the leash we recommend your dog be at least 30 lbs, as smaller dogs are not typically strong enough to utilize the bungee in our leash.

EASILY CONTROL YOUR DOG: It's no fun having to stop right in the middle of an energetic run. Our two conveniently placed handles allow you to control your pup without breaking stride. Use a hands on approach with the handle by your hip to guide your dog back on track, or the collar handle for more direct control in tight situations.

REFLECTIVE THREAD & QUALITY MATERIAL: Designed with luminous reflective stitching that run the length of the leash and the 48" belt to insure you stay safe and visible on your late evening runs. LIFETIME GUARANTEE: Our leash will improve your walks and runs with your dog, or your money back!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
